EmailTemplate.name: 11_05_2015 TurboStack November.Send
EmailTemplate.subject: Win a Homelab, Can You Eliminate Licensing Costs?
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
<http://vmturbo.com/data-center-control?utm_source=vmturbo&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=5-2-webinar&utm_content=05072015> Hi {{lead.First Name:default=There}},
Your data center is more complex than you give it credit for. With a multitude of resources (CPU, RAM, IOPs, NetIO, Balloon, Swap, Buffer, Flow...) whose utilization can assume a multitude of states effecting performance, how do you find a state that satisfies all of the inherent tradeoffs? What about when we add hybrid cloud, containers or webscale application architectures? All of these tradeoffs combine to create an n-dimensional problem beyond human scale.
Click below to see if you can solve this problem, and be entered to win a VMTurbo TurboStack home lab. <http://vmturbo.com/data-center-control?utm_source=vmturbo&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=5-2-webinar&utm_content=05072015>
Enter for a chance to win!
VMTurboStack Homelab
Valued over USD $1300.
Whatâ€™s in the VMTurboStack Home Lab?
- Intel NUC with Intel Core i5-4250U - G.SKILL Ripjaws Series 16GB (2x8G) 204-Pin DDR3 Memory - SAMSUNG 840 EVO 250GB SATA III TLC Internal Solid State Drive - Synology DS415+ Diskless System DiskStation 4-Bay NAS - 2x Dell 1TB 7200 RPM SATA 3.0Gb/s 3.5" Hard Drive - Cisco SG300-10 10-port Gigabit Managed Switch - Rosewill 7ft. Cat 6 Network Cable - VMTurbo Operations Manager 5.1 - OpenStack
-The VMTurbo Team
